Comment.Language: Seven oil lamps and seven candles are lit, and a cross is placed in the midst, to resemble Christ who walks among the seven lampstands (Rev 1).

The priest raises incense while the deacons chant the â€œHymn of the Blessing (Tenouwst m~V~iwt)â€? followed by the Hymn for St. John the Beloved â€œThe blessings (Ere pic~mou)â€? in the tune of â€œThe Time Has Come (Apinau swpi)â€?:
Then the priests start reading the Holy Book of Revelation. Each time the word â€œincenseâ€? is mentioned, the priest offers incense.

Comment.Language: At the end of the reading of the Apocalypse, the deacons chant â€œLord have mercy (K#e#)â€? three times in the great tune, while the priest anoints all the congregation with the oil of the Apocalypse.
